name: 楊詠荍
objective:
This course is an introductory course to materials science and 
will cover the importance of materials selection and materials life cycle. The interaction between molecular, crystal structure, microstructure and chemical to the  mechanical, optical etc properties are discussed
schedule:
Introduction to the course and materials science
Importance of materials
Atomic structures and interatomic bonding
Fundamental concepts of crystal structure
Optical properties-basic concepts
Electromagnetic radiations
Applications of optical phenomenon 
Mid term exam
The structure of crystalline solids
Defects
Structures and properties of ceramics
Applications and processing of ceramics
Environmental issues- End of life
Environmental issues- Recycling
Final exam
materials: An Introduction, W.D. Callister, Jr. and D.G. Rethwisch, 10th edition, John Wiley and Sons, Inc. (2018).
